dialogue: Doctor: How often do you notice this spot?
Patient: I noticed this spot a few days ago.
Doctor: Where on your body do you typically find these spots?
Patient: I typically find these spots on my legs and arms.
Doctor: Do you experience any discomfort or symptoms around this area?
Patient: No, I don't experience any discomfort or symptoms around this area.
Doctor: Is there anything unusual about the texture of this spot?
Patient: Yes, there is something unusual about the texture. It appears to be rougher and more uneven than the surrounding skin.
Doctor: Does the edge of this spot look clear or fuzzy?
Patient: The edge of this spot looks fuzzy.
Doctor: What color is the spot on your skin?
Patient: The spot on my skin is red.
Doctor: Are there other similar spots in other parts of your body?
Patient: No, there are no other similar spots in other parts of my body.
Doctor: Can you describe the shape and size of this spot?
Patient: The spot is irregularly shaped, with a somewhat oval form, and it appears to be about the size of a small coin.
